Message.Issue: Implement IDisposable on 'App' because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: 'Mutex'. If 'App' has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.
Because it is a P/Invoke method, 'App.SetForegroundWindow(IntPtr)' should be defined in a class named NativeMethods, SafeNativeMethods, or UnsafeNativeMethods.
Because it is a P/Invoke method, 'App.ShowWindow(IntPtr, int)' should be defined in a class named NativeMethods, SafeNativeMethods, or UnsafeNativeMethods.
Declare the first parameter of 'DownloadsCompletedEventHandler' as an object named 'sender'.
Declare the second parameter of 'DownloadsCompletedEventHandler' as an EventArgs, or an instance of a type that extends EventArgs, named 'e'.
Declare the first parameter of 'UpdatesRetrievedEventHandler' as an object named 'sender'.
Declare the second parameter of 'UpdatesRetrievedEventHandler' as an EventArgs, or an instance of a type that extends EventArgs, named 'e'.

Implement IDisposable on 'FolderSelectDialog' because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: 'OpenFileDialog'. If 'FolderSelectDialog' has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.

Message.TypeName: Do not dispose objects multiple times
Message.Issue: Object 'stream' can be disposed more than once in method 'Utility.CreateFileFromResource(string, string, bool)'. To avoid generating a System.ObjectDisposedException you should not call Dispose more than one time on an object.: Lines: 91
Because it is a P/Invoke method, 'Win32Imports.FindWindow(IntPtr, string)' should be defined in a class named NativeMethods, SafeNativeMethods, or UnsafeNativeMethods.

To reduce security risk, marshal parameter 'lpWindowName' as Unicode, by setting DllImport.CharSet to CharSet.Unicode, or by explicitly marshaling the parameter as UnmanagedType.LPWStr. If you need to marshal this string as ANSI or system-dependent, specify MarshalAs explicitly, and set BestFitMapping=false; for added security, also set ThrowOnUnmappableChar=true.
Because it is a P/Invoke method, 'Win32Imports.GetForegroundWindow()' should be defined in a class named NativeMethods, SafeNativeMethods, or UnsafeNativeMethods.
Because it is a P/Invoke method, 'Win32Imports.GetProcAddress(IntPtr, string)' should be defined in a class named NativeMethods, SafeNativeMethods, or UnsafeNativeMethods.

If you need to marshal this string as ANSI or system-dependent, specify MarshalAs explicitly, and set BestFitMapping=false; for added security, also set ThrowOnUnmappableChar=true.
Because it is a P/Invoke method, 'Win32Imports.GetWindowText(IntPtr, StringBuilder, int)' should be defined in a class named NativeMethods, SafeNativeMethods, or UnsafeNativeMethods.
Because it is a P/Invoke method, 'Win32Imports.GetWindowTextLength(IntPtr)' should be defined in a class named NativeMethods, SafeNativeMethods, or UnsafeNativeMethods.
Because it is a P/Invoke method, 'Win32Imports.LoadLibrary(string)' should be defined in a class named NativeMethods, SafeNativeMethods, or UnsafeNativeMethods.

To reduce security risk, marshal parameter 'dllToLoad' as Unicode, by setting DllImport.CharSet to CharSet.Unicode, or by explicitly marshaling the parameter as UnmanagedType.LPWStr. If you need to marshal this string as ANSI or system-dependent, specify MarshalAs explicitly, and set BestFitMapping=false; for added security, also set ThrowOnUnmappableChar=true.

Rule.Name: Declare event handlers correctly
Rule.Description: By convention, .NET events have two parameters that specify the event sender and event data. Event handler signatures should follow this form: void MyEventHandler(object sender, EventArgs e). The 'sender' parameter is always of type System.Object, even if it is possible to employ a more specific type. The 'e' parameter is always of type System.EventArgs. Events that do not provide event data should use the System.EventHandler delegate type. Event handlers return void so that they can send each event to multiple target methods. Any value returned by a target would be lost after the first call.
Rule.Resolution: Declare the first parameter of {0} as an object named 'sender'.
Declare the second parameter of {0} as an EventArgs, or an instance of a type that extends EventArgs, named 'e'.

Rule.TypeName: Do not dispose objects multiple times
Rule.Name: Do not dispose objects multiple times
Rule.Description: A correctly implemented Dispose method can be called multiple times without throwing an exception. However, this is not guaranteed and to avoid generating a System.ObjectDisposedException you should not call Dispose more than one time on an object.
Rule.Resolution: Object {0} can be disposed more than once in method {1}. To avoid generating a System.ObjectDisposedException you should not call Dispose more than one time on an object.: Lines: 91

Rule.Name: Do not call overridable methods in constructors
Rule.Description: Virtual methods defined on the class should not be called from constructors. If a derived class has overridden the method, the derived class version will be called (before the derived class constructor is called).
Rule.Resolution: {0} contains a call chain that results in a call to a virtual method defined by the class. Review the following call stack for unintended consequences: {1}

Rule.Name: Move P/Invokes to NativeMethods class
Rule.Description: This type contains members with the DllImport attribute. Members with the DllImport attribute should be contained in classes named NativeMethods, SafeNativeMethods, or UnsafeNativeMethods.
Rule.Resolution: Because it is a P/Invoke method, {0} should be defined in a class named NativeMethods, SafeNativeMethods, or UnsafeNativeMethods.

Rule.Name: Specify marshaling for P/Invoke string arguments
Rule.Description: When marshaling strings as ANSI (or as Auto on Win9x), some characters may be changed. If best-fit mapping is on, strings that appear different in Unicode will be marshaled to identical ANSI strings, which may lead to incorrect security decisions. Turning best-fit mapping off reduces this risk, as all characters without equivalents are mapped to '?'. Also, note that CharSet.Ansi is the default setting for all string marshaling; Unicode marshaling must be specified explicitly, either as a CharSet setting of DllImport or StructLayout, or as a MarshalAs attribute with a Unicode (or system-dependent) UnmanagedType.
Rule.Resolution: To reduce security risk, marshal parameter {0} as Unicode, by setting DllImport.CharSet to CharSet.Unicode, or by explicitly marshaling the parameter as UnmanagedType.LPWStr. If you need to marshal this string as ANSI or system-dependent, specify MarshalAs explicitly, and set BestFitMapping=false; for added security, also set ThrowOnUnmappableChar=true.

Rule.Name: Types that own disposable fields should be disposable
Rule.Description: Types that declare disposable members should also implement IDisposable. If the type does not own any unmanaged resources, do not implement a finalizer on it.
Rule.Resolution: Implement IDisposable on {0} because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: {1}. If {0} has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.
